security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation and planning tool for token budget management. All 176 static findings are false positives from code examples in markdown files. The skill contains no executable code, only educational content showing JavaScript functions, bash commands, and JSON examples for budget planning concepts. No actual security risks identified.

content.user_title: Manage Token Budgets with Intelligent Planning
content.value_statement: Running out of tokens mid-task wastes time and effort. This skill analyzes your token budget, estimates task complexity, and creates chunked execution plans that ensure you complete work within limits.
actual_capabilities: Assess current token usage and calculate remaining budget with safety buffers
Estimate task complexity using base estimates and multipliers for integrations, testing, and documentation
Generate intelligent chunking strategies that decompose large tasks into sequential phases
Create step-by-step execution plans with checkpoints and budget tracking per phase
Provide contingency strategies for budget overruns and scope adjustments
Track historical usage patterns to improve future estimates
limitations: Estimates are based on heuristics and may vary from actual usage by up to 20 percent
Requires manual input of current token usage as automatic tracking is not available
Chunking strategies assume tasks can be logically decomposed into independent phases
Does not automatically execute plans or enforce budget limits during execution

use_cases.title: Pre-Task Budget Planning
use_cases.description: Before starting a large implementation task, analyze if it fits within your remaining budget. Get a chunked execution plan with estimated token usage per phase.

use_cases.title: Multi-Phase Project Coordination
use_cases.description: Break down a full-stack application into research, implementation, testing, and documentation phases. Each phase has clear inputs, outputs, and checkpoint strategies.

use_cases.title: Budget Recovery After Exhaustion
use_cases.description: When a previous task failed due to token limits, analyze what went wrong and create a revised plan that completes remaining work within available budget.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Budget Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: I have used 45000 tokens out of 200000. Help me assess my current budget status and available capacity.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick budget health check before starting work

prompt_templates.title: Task Complexity Estimation
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to build an authentication system with OAuth, JWT, and user management. Estimate the token complexity for this task.
prompt_templates.scenario: Understanding resource requirements for a specific feature

prompt_templates.title: Chunking Strategy Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to implement a full e-commerce application. Current usage is 36000 out of 200000 tokens. Generate a chunked execution plan.
prompt_templates.scenario: Breaking down large projects into manageable phases

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Planning with Constraints
prompt_templates.prompt: I have 80000 tokens remaining and need to complete API integration, testing, and documentation. Prioritize critical work and defer low-value tasks if needed.
prompt_templates.scenario: Optimizing execution when budget is constrained

output_examples.input: Current usage: 36000/200000 tokens. Task: Build full-stack e-commerce app.
output: Budget Status: 164000 tokens remaining, 134000 available after 15 percent buffer, Status: Healthy
Task Estimate: 68000 tokens with high confidence (base 40000 for full-stack, 1.7x multiplier for integrations and testing)
Chunking Strategy: 4 sequential chunks - Research and Planning (12000 tokens), Core Implementation (20000 tokens), Testing (18000 tokens), Documentation (18000 tokens)
Recommendation: Execute with confidence, 66000 tokens safety margin after completion

output_examples.input: Current usage: 180000/200000 tokens. Task: Add user authentication feature.
output: Budget Status: 20000 tokens remaining, Status: Critical
Task Estimate: 15000 tokens (feature implementation with authentication complexity)
Recommendation: Defer this task to next session. Current budget too constrained for safe execution with buffer.

best_practices: Always maintain a 15 percent safety buffer to handle estimation variance and unexpected complexity
Run budget analysis before starting any task estimated to use more than 20000 tokens
Track actual versus estimated token usage at each checkpoint to improve future estimates
anti_patterns: Starting large tasks without checking remaining budget can lead to incomplete work and wasted tokens
Ignoring estimation confidence levels may result in poor planning for unfamiliar task types
Skipping checkpoint reviews prevents mid-course corrections when chunks exceed estimates

faq.question: How accurate are the token estimates?
faq.answer: Estimates typically have 20 percent variance. High confidence estimates with 3 or more identified complexity factors are more accurate than low confidence generic estimates.

faq.question: What is the safety buffer and why is it needed?
faq.answer: The 15 percent safety buffer (30000 tokens for 200000 limit) protects against estimation errors and unexpected complexity. It ensures you do not hit hard limits mid-task.

faq.question: Can this skill automatically track my token usage?
faq.answer: No, you must manually provide current token usage. The skill focuses on analysis and planning rather than runtime tracking.

faq.question: What happens if a chunk exceeds its estimate?
faq.answer: The execution plan includes contingency strategies: stop at a natural breakpoint, store progress, reassess remaining budget, and adjust subsequent chunks or defer work.

faq.question: How does chunking help with large tasks?
faq.answer: Chunking breaks tasks into logical phases with clear inputs and outputs. Each chunk uses 40 percent of available budget, allowing safe incremental progress with checkpoint recovery.

faq.question: What task types have the highest token costs?
faq.answer: Full-stack development (40000 base tokens) and migrations (20000 base) are most expensive. Simple edits (2000 base) and documentation (4000 base) are cheapest.
